meanings.definition: To remove a vehicle by towing it away.
meanings.sent1: The tow truck will towaway the broken car.
meanings.sent2: The city will towaway any cars parked illegally.
meanings.sent3: The towaway of the car was so sudden, it surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to towaway his doubts about the decision.
meanings.sent5: The storm threatened to towaway everything in its path.

meanings.definition: A place where vehicles are towed away.
meanings.sent1: The towaway is full of cars waiting to be claimed.
meanings.sent2: He parked in the towaway and had to pay a fine.
meanings.sent3: The towaway seemed like a car graveyard to the little boy.
meanings.sent4: The towaway loomed in the distance like a forbidden zone.
meanings.sent5: The towaway sign was a warning to all who parked there.
